adjectives.description: actinopterygian (comparative more actinopterygian, superlative most actinopterygian)

entries.meaning: Of the nature of fish of the class Actinopterygii.
examples: Still more Actinopterygian is the skeleton of the pelvic fin; here only four bony radials are preserved, separately articulating with the pelvic girdle.

entries.meaning: (zoology) Any of the ray-finned fish of the taxonomic class Actinopterygii.
examples: The ear of all nonteleostean actinopterygian fishes (Grande and Bemis 1996) does not differ much from that of ratfish (considered by most an ancient line of cartilaginous fish), with the notable exception of the position of the ultricular macula.
